medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The mother began experiencing genital candidosis at the age of 3 years, with nails affected at age 4. She presented with herpetic vesicles two to four times per year from age 5, had chicken pox at 5, shingles at 6, and developed cutaneous herpes lesions at 21. At 30, she had another shingles episode and at 45, she experienced retrosternal discomfort and pain on swallowing solid food. The daughter had recurrent oral and pharyngeal candidosis since infancy, genital and nail candidosis from ages 12 and 16, recurrent HSV infections primarily affecting lips and mouth from age 6, and two cutaneous varicella infections affecting the right thigh and knee.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The mother had one episode of pneumococcal pleuropneumonia at age 38 and a narrowing of the oesophagus diagnosed by gastroscopy at age 45 where Candida albicans was isolated.
medical_history.family_history: Both patients carried a heterozygous germ line mutation in the STAT1 gene.
